context.p: Manipulation commands, such as , and prompt you to select one or more entities. If the PICKFIRST variable is ON, you can also compose the selection set before launching the command.
provides several selection methods. You can combine selection methods to compose a selection set.

step.cmd: Move the cursor over the entity.

stepresult.p: The Quad appears and displays the most recently used command and a selection of the entity properties.

choices.choice: Repeatedly press the Tab key to highlight obscured entities and click when the desired entity highlights.

step.cmd: Repeat the previous steps to select more entities or launch a command.

taskbody.context: uses window selection methods to select multiple entities:

step.cmd: Click to define the corner of the selection rectangle.

choices.choice: Move the cursor to the right. A blue rectangle displays. The circle inside the rectangle icon indicates all entities that lie completely within the selection rectangle will be selected.

Move the cursor to the left. A green rectangle displays. The circle overlapping the rectangle icon indicates that all entities which either lie within or overlap the selection rectangle will be selected.

step.cmd: Click to define the opposite corner of the selection rectangle.

task.title: Removing entities from a selection set

context.p: Hold down the Shift key when executing a selection method, to remove entities from the current selection set.
Press the Esc key to clear the current selection set.
